thread.title: Ratnam

author: Ratnam
title: Ratnam
text:
The technician who fitted the tyres was very professional and in my view a good ambassador for the company.
The person who made the booking also very courteous and friendly.
One concern I have is that only after fitting the tyres I was informed that the company has not replaced the values that were part of deal for replacing four 'runflat' tyres on a BMW 5 series 15 reg.
When I raised this, I was told that my car had sensors therefore deal ( wheel balancing, replacement valves, disposal of tyres) I had, does not apply to my car and it only applies to cars with standard valves. Given the make and the age of my car and the fact it has runflat tyres, it should be obvious to the company, 'tyresonthedrive ' that my car does not have standard valves and instead, it has non-standard valves with sensors. The company could have told me at the outset when I booked the car that replacement of valves is not included in the deal because of the reason above.
'tyresonthedrive' needs to be more transparent to customers
